intro: Phelypaea, commonly known as the water clover, is a genus of aquatic plants belonging to the family Hydrocharitaceae. These plants are characterized by their delicate, branching stems and small, floating leaves that resemble clover leaves, hence their common name. Phelypaea species are typically found in freshwater environments such as ponds, lakes, and slow-moving streams. They play an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for microorganisms and small aquatic life. The genus includes several species, with Phelypaea acuta and Phelypaea minor being among the most commonly encountered.
